revised_title: Raman Effect on Water and Electrolytes: Temperature and Concentration Study
tldr: The authors studied the behavior of water and electrolytes using the Raman effect, observing changes in the Raman bands with varying temperature and electrolyte concentration. They found that the water bands sharpen and shift towards shorter wavelengths as temperature and electrolyte concentration increase. This research provides insights into the molecular structure and interactions of water and electrolytes under different conditions.
